definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: However, Massimo Ambronisi equalized in the 25th minute for Milan.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，安布羅西尼在25分鐘爲米蘭扳平了比分。

sentences.english: The final score will depend on whether those stories are published.
sentences.chinese: 最後的比分，要看那些報道是否能夠刊發。

sentences.english: But in the 59th minute, Corradi attacks the worn-out host front door tying score.
sentences.chinese: 而在第59分鐘，科拉迪攻破舊主大門追平比分。

sentences.english: We managed to equalise and weren't capable of maintaining the result.
sentences.chinese: 我們努力追平了比分，但遺憾的是沒有保持到最後。

sentences.english: I was a point from losing this match, and now I managed to come back.
sentences.chinese: 就差一分輸掉比賽，現在我設法將比分扳了回來。

sentences.english: Organised the defence, and scored Italy’s equaliser.
sentences.chinese: 組織起了本方的防守，並且打進了扳平比分的一球。

sentences.english: The score Was tied, there will be a replay next Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 比分相平，下星期天將重賽一場。

sentences.english: Their team beat ours by a large score.
sentences.chinese: 他們隊以很高比分打敗了我們隊。

sentences.english: Gilberto replied immediately and the visitors came close to an equaliser.
sentences.chinese: 吉爾博托馬上回敬一球，阿森納一度接近扳平比分。

sentences.english: Our te am beat theirs by a big score.
sentences.chinese: 我隊以懸殊比分擊敗他們的隊。

sentences.english: Points, for example, aren’t rewards as much as a method of supplying real-time feedback for building competence.
sentences.chinese: 例如實時反饋比分數更利於建立人們的競爭力。

sentences.english: He labelled it a "dangerous" scoreline, and that is the voice of experience.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲這個比分是“危險的”，這也是經驗之談。
比分爲德國隊一比零勝。

sentences.english: The score was five-nil with five minute left in the game.
sentences.chinese: 角逐離開場還有五分鐘時，兩邊比分爲五比零。

sentences.english: The score was five- nil with five minute left in the game.
sentences.chinese: 比賽離終場還有五分鐘時，雙方比分爲五比零。

sentences.english: I prefer to remember Gilberto getting the equaliser, though!
sentences.chinese: 不過，我更願意記住的是吉爾伯託扳平了比分。

definition: to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
half of a game or contest/half-court
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
(of a team) to throw oneself into the battle
opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc
